definitions.definition: A recognizable pattern of signs , symptoms and/or behaviours , especially of a disease or medical or psychological condition.
examples: Down syndrome ; acquired immune deficiency syndrome ; restless-leg syndrome ; battered-wife syndrome

definitions.definition: Any set of characteristics regarded as identifying a certain type, condition, etc., usually adverse .

main_definition: ( pathology ) A recognizable pattern of signs , symptoms and/or behaviours , especially of a disease or medical or psychological condition.
secondary_definitions: Any set of characteristics regarded as identifying a certain type, condition, etc., usually adverse .
